intro: Fumaria rupestris subsp. rupestris, commonly known as the rock fumewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often hairy, with a distinctive lobed or toothed margin. This subspecies is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, calcareous habitats.
